Sentence.sentence: Not many young people eligible for voting are interested in local or national elections these days.

It is also troubling that voting rates among our youngest eligible voters—18- to 24-year-olds—are way down: Little more than one in four now go to the polls, even in national elections, compared with almost twice that many when 18-year-olds were first given the vote.
It did not escape notice that a lobbying firm set up by Lynton Crosby, David Cameron's election campaign director, had previously acted for Philip Morris International.
That should be a matter of concern in a presidential election year.
That is not surprising: politicians with an eye on the next election will hardly rush to introduce unpopular measures that may not bear fruit for years, perhaps decades.
One reason why pension and health care reforms are slow in coming is that politicians are afraid of losing votes in the next election.
politicians are afraid of losing votes in the next election.
Obama's success isn't all good news for black Americans As Erin White watched the election results head towards victory for Barack Obama, she felt a burden lifting from her shoulders
After his election victory, this was true of all the black participants
Just one week after Obama was elected president, participants were less ready to support policies designed to address racial inequality than they had been two weeks before the election.
So the election of a female leader might have a downside for other women
How did Erin White feel upon seeing Barack Obama's victory in the election?
blacks and whites behaved differently during the election
Obama's election has eliminated the prejudice against blacks
Young voters played a decisive role in Obama's election
Pierre Salinger was appointed senator from California but subsequently lost his first election.
M :well ,that guy won't be able to win the election unless he got the majority vote from women students ,and I am not sure about it ?
It won't be easy for Mark to win the election
Females are more competitive than males in elections.

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含有"选择"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: choice, alternative, preference, option, selection, election
means: choice ： 侧重指自由选择的权利或特权。
alternative ： 指在相互排斥的两者之间作严格的选择，也可指在两者以上中进行选择。
preference ： 侧重因偏见、爱好或判断等而进行选择。
option ： 着重特别给予的选择权利或权力，所选物常常相互排斥。
selection ： 指作广泛的选择，着重选择者的识别力或鉴赏力。
election ： 强调目的和达到目的判断能力。

stems_affixes.word_buile: collect[v.收集]+ive……的→adj.集体的,共同的 n.集体

stems_affixes.value_cn: 智力的,理智的,有理解力的
stems_affixes.word_buile: intellect[n.理智,智力,才智]+ual……的→n.知识分子 adj.智力的,理智的,有理解力的
collect[v.收集]+ion表名词→n.收藏[品],收集[物]
collect[v.收集]+ive……的→adj.集体的,共同的 n.集体
elect[v.选举,推选;选择,作出选择]+ion表名词→n.选举,选择权;当选

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有选举权的人,选举人,竞选人
stems_affixes.word_buile: elect[v.选举,推选;选择,作出选择]+or人→n.有选举权的人,选举人,竞选人

stems_affixes.value_cn: [集合名词]精华;精锐;中坚分子;精英
stems_affixes.word_buile: el=elect[v.选举,推选;选择,作出选择]+ite人→选出的人→精英
intel=inter在……中间+lect选择,收集→在中间选出的人→智者
intellect[n.理智,智力,才智]+ual……的→n.知识分子 adj.智力的,理智的,有理解力的
recollect[v.回忆,想起,记起,忆起,记得]+ion表名词→n.回忆
select[v.选出]+ion表名词→n.选择,挑选;选集,精选物
acro高+lect讲,读,说→高层说的话
dia对着+lect讲,读,说→两个对着说→方言
idio个人的+lect说→个人说的话
neg没有+lect选择,收集→没有选出→疏忽
lect讲,读,说+ure表名词→n.&v.演讲,讲课
col共同+lect选择→放在一起选择→收集

stems_affixes.value_cn: 选举,推选;选择,作出选择
stems_affixes.word_buile: e出+lect选择,收集→选出

stems_affixes.value_cn: 回忆,想起,记起,忆起,记得
stems_affixes.word_buile: re重新+collect[v.收集]→重新收集[集中]→回想到
se分开+lect选→选出分开

Sentence.sentence: At the next election none of the big parties seem likely to endorse this sentiment.
Mayor Jose Luis Martinez-Almeida made opposition to the zone a centrepiece of his election campaign, despite its success in improving air quality.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Seven months and one election day later, a new conservative city council suspended enforcement of the clean air zone, a first step toward its possible demise.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: The new ultra-low emission zone Ulez is likely to be a big issue in next year's mayoral election.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

means.word_mean: 选举, 当选, 推举

sentences.en: Charles declared the result of the election.
sentences.cn: 查尔斯宣布了选举结果。</seg>

entry.def: An election is a process in which people vote to choose a person or group of people to hold an official position.

example.ex: ...the first fully free elections for more than fifty years...
example.tran: 50多年来第一次完全自由的选举

example.ex: During his election campaign he promised to put the economy back on its feet...
example.tran: 在竞选活动中，他承诺恢复经济活力。

entry.def: The election of a particular person or group of people is their success in winning an election.

example.ex: ...the election of the Labour government in 1964.

means.word_mean: 1. a vote to select the winner of a position or political office;

sentences.sentence: "the results of the election will be announced tonight"

means.word_mean: 2. the act of selecting someone or something; the exercise of deliberate choice;

sentences.sentence: "her election of medicine as a profession"

means.word_mean: 3. the status or fact of being elected;
4. the predestination of some individuals as objects of divine mercy (especially as conceived by Calvinists)

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: via Old French from Latin electio(n-), from eligere 'pick out' (see elect)

sentences.en: While quality of life has improved, there's still a lot of burnout.

sentences.cn: 他们操纵选票的消息使他们在选举中获得的胜利大为减色.
sentences.en: The news of rigged ballots has rubbed off much of the shine of their election victory.

sentences.en: The election campaign heated up in that state.

sentences.cn: 他们想以发展贸易的纲领来赢得下次选举.
sentences.en: They intend to win the next election on the plank of developing trade.

sentences.cn: 在即将到来的大选中,该政府很可能要垮台.
sentences.en: The government will probably fall at the coming election.

sentences.cn: 政府因未能履行大选中所许下的种种诺言而受到指责.
sentences.en: The government has been charged with walking out on its election promises.

sentences.cn: 失败的选举结果使政府惊慌失措.
sentences.en: The poor election results confounded the government.

sentences.cn: 上次大选中该党获胜执政.
sentences.en: The party came in at the last election.

sentences.en: Charles declared the result of the election.

sentences.cn: 他们仅以微弱的多数赢得了选举.
sentences.en: They won the election but only with a very slender majority.

sentences.cn: 似乎普遍的看法是这次选举将在六月份举行.
sentences.en: There seems to be a general feeling that the election will be held in June.

sentences.en: We must pick up the pieces of our political defeat, and start working towards the next election.

sentences.cn: 选举的结果并不总是真实地反映出选民的观点.
sentences.en: The election results do not always reflect back the views of voters.

sentences.en: At the next election none of the big parties seem likely to endorse this sentiment.

sentences.en: The financial crisis in the Orthodox Church we are living a sober and rational wisdom.

sentences.en: The news of rigged ballots has rubbed off much of the shine of their election victory.

sentences.cn: 白俄罗斯于三月十九日举行总统大选,隔日官方公布选举结果.
sentences.en: Belarus held a presidential election on March 19 and announced the official election the following day.

sentences.cn: 国家选举委员会应该证实这些结果.
sentences.en: The National Election Council is supposed to certify the results.

sentences.cn: 就是次选举,每一位选举委员会委员只可签署一份提名表格.
sentences.en: Member of the Election Committee should subscribe to only ONE nomination form election.

sentences.cn: 每隔4年进行一次选举,国会一年开一次会.
sentences.en: Elections take place every four years and Congress meets once a year.

sentences.cn: 法官选举竞争在许多州都在不断进行.
sentences.en: In many states, elections for judges are increasingly competitive.

sentences.cn: 地方监察人员就已经在选举前谴责了投票人登记系统上与选区划分问题上出现的不规则情况.
sentences.en: Local watchdogs have decried irregularities in voter registration ahead of the election and in demarking constituencies.

sentences.cn: 在上星期五举行的总统选举中,他获得了63%的选票.
sentences.en: He won 63 % of the vote in the Kenyan presidential election last Friday.

sentences.cn: 你对选举结果有什么看法?
sentences.en: How would you react to the election results?

sentences.cn: 选举看来完全失控了.
sentences.en: The election looked like straying out of total control.

sentences.cn: 到那时我们就能知道选举的结果了.
sentences.en: By then we shall know the result of the election.

sentences.cn: 两位候选人都来征求我对选举得意见.
sentences.en: Both candidates solicited my opinion about the election.

sentences.cn: 上周六公布的选举结果显示,内贾德取得压倒性胜利.
sentences.en: The election results announced Saturday showed overwhelming victory for Mr. Ahmadinejad.

sentences.cn: “人民联盟”大呼犯规, 抵制选举,把狂热的支持者召集到街上.
sentences.en: The AL screamed foul, boycotted the election and called its thugs onto the streets.

sentences.cn: 俄罗斯此次杜马选举的合法选民达到1.08亿人,约63%的选民参与了投票.
sentences.en: Some 63 percent of the 108 million eligible voters took part in the elections.

sentences.cn: 澳大利亚选举即将在8月21号落幕,真是令人遗憾.
sentences.en: WHAT a shame that Australia's election concludes on August 21 st.

sentences.cn: 如果他们感到我受到了不应有的待遇,他们定会在此次选举中袖手旁观.
sentences.en: If they felt I had been treated badly they might decide to sit out the election.

sentences.cn: 他在选举中失去了议会中的席位.
sentences.en: He lost his seat in the Parliament at the election.

sentences.cn: 大选必须五年举行一次,但经常不到五年就进行一次选举.
sentences.en: A general Election must be held every five years and is often at more frequent intervals.

sentences.cn: 在1999年区议会选举中,标准人口基数是定于17, 043的水平.
sentences.en: The population quota in 1999 District Council elections was set at the level of 17, 043.

sentences.cn: 民意测试已经预示总统选举将很快结束.
sentences.en: Polls had indicated that the presidential election was going to be close.

sentences.cn: 我们欢迎他当选总统。
sentences.en: We welcome his election as president.

sentences.en: ...the election of the Labour government in 1964.

sentences.cn: 他当选总统
sentences.en: ...his election as president...

sentences.cn: 一个年纪不是很大的亚伯达人当选为总理,这将有助于缓解加拿大东部和西部之间的矛盾.
sentences.en: The election of a relatively young Albertan as prime minister should help ease western alienation.

sentences.cn: 哈德贝里将自己的当选部分归功于2005年的“沿河游行”事件.
sentences.en: Mr Hardberger owes his election in part to the 2005 River Parade.

sentences.cn: 一个“黑马”候选人当选了.
sentences.en: A dark horse candidate gets elected in the election.

sentences.cn: 他轻易地当选了.
sentences.en: He won the election hands down.

sentences.cn: 史密斯先生以20万张的多数票轻易当选了.
sentences.en: Mr Smith breezed in with an election plurality of 200, 000.

sentences.cn: 有时在大选中一个料想不到的候选人会当选.
sentences.en: It happens sometimes that a dark horse candidate gets elected in great election.

sentences.cn: 他在争取下周当选.
sentences.en: He's contesting the election next week.

sentences.cn: 他的当选纯属侥幸.
sentences.en: His election victory was just a fluke.

sentences.cn: 最后是领取养老金者的选票影响了斯威特先生的当选.
sentences.en: It was the pensioner's vote late in the day that influenced the election of Mr. Sweet.

sentences.cn: 这种可耻的伎俩都是为了能让他当选.
sentences.en: These shameful manoeuvreswere aimed at securing his election.

sentences.cn: 考虑到舆论的变化, 汤姆应以多出大约一千的票当选.
sentences.en: Allowing theswing of the pendulum, Tom should the election by about a thousand votes.

sentences.cn: 恭喜当选.
sentences.en: Congratulations on your success in the election!

sentences.cn: 我们的高升与肯尼迪的当选差不多同时发生.
sentences.en: Our appointments coincided with the election of Kenned.

sentences.cn: 肯尼亚,基苏木:肯尼亚民众在奥巴马老家庆祝奥巴马顺利当选.
sentences.en: Kenyans celebrated Senator Barack Obama's election victory athomestead near Kisumu , in western Kenya.

sentences.cn: 看到他到处受欢迎的样子, 他们觉得他当选是十拿九稳的.
sentences.en: Judging by the enthusiastic reception given him everywhere, they felt that his election was in the bag.

sentences.cn: 奥巴马当选美国总统或雷曼兄弟破产将被证明是更为重要的事件 吗 ?
sentences.en: Will the election of Mr Obama prove to be another epochal event?

sentences.cn: 他的当选宣告了一个新时代的到来.
sentences.en: His election signaled the birth of a new age.

sentences.cn: 在更南的地方, 奥巴马先生当选的结果显得十分戏剧化.
sentences.en: Farther south, the results of Mr Obama's election seem dramatic.

sentences.cn: 民建联共派出约二百人参选,但只有约三成当选.
sentences.en: Only about 30 per cent of about 200 DAB candidates won in the elections.

sentences.cn: 大选来临, 布坎南先生当选, 似乎得到了人民的支持.
sentences.en: The election came. Mr. Buchanan was elected indorsement, such as it was, secured.

sentences.cn: 共和党的全国委员会甚至在艾森豪威尔先生当选总统之后仍然是保守派的堡垒.
sentences.en: The Republican National Committee remained an Old Guard stronghold even after Mr Eisenhower's election.

sentences.cn: 各个党派在选举前联盟在一起,而一旦各自的人选当选后他们的联盟就会被拆散.
sentences.en: Factions tend to coalesce before elections and then apart once they have got their man in.

sentences.cn: 我希望下次大选中这位德高望重之人能当选.
sentences.en: I hope that the prestigious man will be put into power at the next election.

sentences.cn: 往往, 黑马出人意料的胜利和当选.
sentences.en: Sometimes, a dark horse unexpectedly wins and election.

sentences.cn: 在吉米.卡特当选总统后不久, 他的顾问们就建议应当降低税收,扩大政府开支.
sentences.en: Shortly after Jimmy Carter's election as President, his advisers recommended lower taxes and higher government spending.

sentences.cn: 你满唔满意自己所属选区既选举结果, 包括无须投票而自动当选者?
sentences.en: Are you satisfied with the election results of your constituency, including those candidates elected uncontested?

sentences.cn: 第十条妇女享有与男子平等的选举权和被选举权.
sentences.en: Article 10. Women shall enjoy the equal right , with men, to vote and to stand election.

sentences.cn: 4年前科威特妇女才开始拥有选举权和被选举权.
sentences.en: Women were first allowed to vote and for election 4 four years ago.

sentences.cn: 在中国,凡年满18岁的公民, 都有选举权和被选举权.
sentences.en: In China, every citizen who has reached the age of eighteen has the right to vote and stand for election.

sentences.cn: 第十一条妇女享有与男子平等的选举权和被选举权.
sentences.en: Article 11 Women shall enjoy the equal right , with men, to vote and to stand election.

sentences.cn: 尽了纳税义务的人都享有选举权.
sentences.en: The election was free to every one that paid scot and lot.

Sentence.sentence: After Hurricane Florence and Hurricane Michael last fall, USPS worked with state and local election boards to make sure that absentee ballots were available and received or time.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月四级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B
